title: How to Sew a Straight Line

steps.headline: Get your fabric ready.
steps.description: Pre-wash you fabric. Washing your fabric is important, since it can shrink.

steps.headline: Pull the thread through the eye of a sewing needle.
Draw a guide.
steps.description: Draw a straight line onto your fabric. Use special sewing chalk or washable pens that are easily removable. Use something straight - a book, cardboard, boxes or a simple ruler - to draw a line that is truly straight. This line will be your guide through the sewing process.

steps.headline: Tie a knot at the end of the thread to make sure the end of the thread doesn't go through the fabric.
Finish the straight line and tie off the thread.
steps.description: Go through the loop of the last stitch to secure it. Make another stitch and go through this loop one more time. Pull tight and weave in the loose ends.

methods.name: Sewing a Straight Line Using a Sewing Machine

steps.headline: Use a guide.
steps.description: To help you make a straight line while sewing, you will need something to guide you. Some sewing machines have a seam guide engraved in the machine. It will help tremendously while sewing straight lines. If you don't have a seam guide on your machine or it isn't helpful for you, try using a headband, elastic or tape, to wrap around the arm of your sewing machine.

steps.headline: Start your sewing line with a backstitch and carefully and slowly guide the fabric through your sewing machine with the seam guide, headband, elastic or tape to guide you.
Use a backstitch to secure the thread to finish the seam.
steps.description: Cut the loose ends with a pair of scissors.
